problem_text:
18.58.
Let G be a group generated by finite number n of involutions in which (uv)4 = 1 for all involutions u, v ∈ G. Is it true that G is finite? is a 2-group? This is true for n ⩽ 3.
Editors’ comment of 2021: the previously published claim of an affirmative solution of this problem proved to be erroneous.
D. V. Lytkina
